t: For the choir director. Of David, the Lord’s servant.
An*pn oracle within my heart concerning*ln the transgression of the wicked person: Dread*ln of God has no effect on him.
For*ln with his flattering opinion of himself, he*ln does not discover and hate his iniquity.
The*ln words from his mouth are malicious and deceptive; he*ln has stopped acting wisely and doing good.
Even*ln on his bed he makes malicious plans. He*ln sets himself on a path that is not good, and*ln he does not reject evil.
Lord,*spn your faithful love reaches to heaven, your*ln faithfulness to the clouds.
Your*ln righteousness is like the highest mountains, your*ln judgments like the deepest sea. Lord,*sln you preserve people and animals.
How*ln priceless your faithful love is, God! People*ln take refuge in the shadow of your wings.
They*ln are filled from the abundance of your house. You*ln let them drink from your refreshing stream.
For*ln the wellspring of life is with you. By*ln means of your light we see light.
Spread*pn your faithful love over those who know you, and*ln your righteousness over the upright in heart.
Do*ln not let the foot of the arrogant come near me or*ln the hand of the wicked drive me away.
There!*ln The evildoers have fallen. They*ln have been thrown down and cannot rise.
